author: Andrew Ferebee
review: The book emphasizes working on yourself to become a more confident and attractive person, rather than just using pick-up tactics.It provides practical tips and strategies for approaching women, starting conversations, and building relationships. The book avoids the idea of a magic bullet and acknowledges that dating takes effort.

author: Joe Percia
review: Percia emphasizes attracting clients through honest and valuable content, rather than pushy sales tactics.While geared towards fitness professionals, reviewers say the principles can be applied to marketing in various fields.The book is said to be well-suited for those new to marketing and copywriting.

author: Ange Thomas
review: Many readers find the story about Starr Carter, a teenager navigating two different worlds, incredibly moving and thought-provoking. It sheds light on police brutality, racism, and the complexities of identity.

author: Jane Austen
review: The Scholarship Monthly Planner could be a helpful tool, especially for those who prefer a physical organization system. However, it's important to consider the potential limitations and explore digital resources as well.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: Jack and Riley want to extend their small family of three. Their first choice is surrogacy with Jack as the father and when all this begins smoothly both men can't help but contemplate at what point would things go wrong. After all, their lives are far from normal and nothing is ever smooth.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: Love is conditional, argues Puhn, and for love to survive, couples don't need to talk more they need to talk better. With exercises, examples, and sample scripts, Puhn's simple 5-minute strategies promise immediate results and provide long-lasting communication skills that couples can confidently employ when faced with future conflict

author: Sakyong Miplian
review: Cutting through all the white noise, chatter, and superficiality our cell phones and social media cause, one of Tibet's highest and most respected spiritual leaders offers simple and practical advice to help us increase our attentions spans, become better listeners, and strive to appreciate the people around us.

author: J.K. Rowling
review: A true crime blogger gets more than she bargained for while interviewing the woman acquitted of two cold case slayings in this chilling new novel from the New York Times bestselling author of The Sun Down Motel.

author: Kevin J Anderson
review: Two continents at war, the Three Kingdoms and Ishara, are divided by past bloodshed. When an outside threat arises—the reawakening of a powerful ancient race that wants to remake the world—the two warring nations must somehow set aside generational hatreds and form an alliance to fight their true enemy.
